dkeep.logic

Class Ogre

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Character
      • dkeep.logic.Ogre

  • public class Ogre
extends Character
    Ogre extends the Character class and implements a few of its abstract methods. One of the game's enemy types.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ogre(int ogreX, int ogreY, int clubX, int clubY)
      Constructs a new Ogre given its X and Y coordinates and also its club's X and Y coordinates.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkAdjacentOgre(int X, int Y)
      Returns true if the ogre is not stunned and its position is adjacent to the (X,Y) position.
      boolean isAdjacent(int X, int Y)
      Returns true if: - the ogre is not stunned and its position is adjacent to the (X,Y) position; - the club's position is adjacent to the (X,Y) position; Returns false other wise.
      void move(char[][] table)
      Gets the direction the ogre should move in according to both its movement strategy and the level's table (ogre must move into a free tile).
      void setStunned(boolean value)
      Sets the character's 'stunned' attribute to 'value'.
      void updateClubPosition(int direction)
      Method to update the clubs's position.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ogre

        public Ogre(int ogreX,
            int ogreY,
            int clubX,
            int clubY)
        Constructs a new Ogre given its X and Y coordinates and also its club's X and Y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        ogreX - ogre's x coordinate
        ogreY - ogre's y coordinate
        clubX - club's x coordinate
        clubY - club's y coordinate

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(char[][] table)
        Gets the direction the ogre should move in according to both its movement strategy and the level's table (ogre must move into a free tile). If the ogre is not stunned, its position is updated using the direction mentioned above. The ogre's club position is always updated (this means the ogre may swing its club even when stunned).
        Specified by:
        move in class Character
        Parameters:
        table - char matrix that represents the level's table.
        See Also:
        Level, Guard, Ogre

      • updateClubPosition

        public void updateClubPosition(int direction)
        Method to update the clubs's position. The direction parameter has four possible values: 2 means down, 4 means left, 6 means right and 8 means up.
        Parameters:
        direction - integer value that indicates where the club will move to

      • checkAdjacentOgre

        public boolean checkAdjacentOgre(int X,
                                 int Y)
        Returns true if the ogre is not stunned and its position is adjacent to the (X,Y) position. Returns false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        X - x value of the desired position
        Y - y value of the desired position

      • isAdjacent

        public boolean isAdjacent(int X,
                          int Y)
        Returns true if: - the ogre is not stunned and its position is adjacent to the (X,Y) position; - the club's position is adjacent to the (X,Y) position; Returns false other wise. This method will be used to verify if the ogre kills the hero.
        Specified by:
        isAdjacent in class Character
        Parameters:
        X - x value of the desired position
        Y - y value of the desired position
        See Also:
        Hero, Guard, Ogre

      • setStunned

        public void setStunned(boolean value)
        Sets the character's 'stunned' attribute to 'value'. It also sets the ogre's display char according to 'value'. The 'stunned' attribute indicates if the character is stunned.
        Specified by:
        setStunned in class Character
        Parameters:
        value - the boolean value that 'stunned' will be set to
        See Also:
        Ogre
